result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christian T. Norton in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 15CF41, 15CF65, 15CF191, 15CF243, 15CF244
10:52 a.m.  Court calls the cases. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 15CF243 Counts 1, 2 & 4 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
Court notes the plea/questionaire indicates 15CF41. 
Atty McFarland does not object to the Court replacing that with the correct case number 15CF243.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CF243 Counts 1, 2 & 4.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Dismissed and read-in are the following: 
15CF243 Counts 3 & 5
15CF244
15CF191
15CF65
15CF41

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty McFarland makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
15CF243 Counts 1 & 2 -
Serve 150 days jail - STAYED - 
3 days credit.
24 months probation, concurrent to any probation he is currently on in Illinois:
Obtain AODA and comply with treatment recommendations.
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Only use 1 pharmacy to obtain any prescription medications he needs and notify agent of that pharmacy and sign any necessary releases so the agent can monitor. 
Maintain fulltime employment or schooling or combination of both.
Participate in any other assessment or counseling deemed appropriate by the agent. 
Provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge. 
Pay costs.  To be paid during the period of probation. 

15CF243 Count 4 - 
Pay fine of $250 plus costs.  To be taken out of any bond posted on any of the files.  Any remainder to be applied to the costs in counts 1 & 2. Balance to be paid within 60 days or set up a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office.
Atty McFarland
Plea hearing at 01-06-2016 10:30 am
Defendant Record Update
Pre-trial conference at 10-12-2015 10:00 am
Pre-trial conference at 08-24-2015 09:00 am

Prior: 1353 South Blue Island Aot C6, Chicago, IL 60608 United States
Defendant Record Update
Pre-trial conference at 08-03-2015 09:00 am
Status conference at 06-08-2015 01:30 pm

1:03 p.m.
ADA Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

Cases: 15CF65 and 15CF41 warrants are vacated and to follow new charge. To schedule as status hearings.
  06-08-2015  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 3  Status conference scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
cc:da w/mins ss 05-27-15
Notice of bond forfeit

Body Only.
sent to JR 5/26/15 ks

Attorney Erik John Mcfarland in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 15CF41, 15CF65

10:23 a.m.  Court calls the cases. 
Atty McFarland has no explanation for his client's absence.  He lives in Chicago.  Has been maintaining phone contact with him since the intial appearance. 
Atty Knaapen asks for a bench warrant in both of the files.  Asks the $500 cash bond posted be forfeited and the warrants be body only. 
Atty McFarland makes additional statements.  Believes the Defendant did intend to be here today.  
Atty Knaapen indicates he received a call from Illinois.  They have charges for him there. 

BY THE COURT: Court notes the notice was sent out on April 1.  It is now 10:26 a.m.  Defendant has failed to appear and authorizes a bench warrant on both files and bond is forfeited.
Arraignment at 05-26-2015 10:00 am

2/23/15 Bond is modified to Day report on days he has Court scheduled.

Preliminary hearing on March 23, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Christian T. Norton in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 15CF41, 15CF65

Attorney/Defendant received copy of the criminal complaints.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives the reading of the complaints.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bond Continued in 15CF41.   Bond in 15CF41 covers 15CF65. 

Atty McFarland makes arguments re: day report condition.  Defendant is no longer at the dorms and has to move to Chicago.  

BY THE COURT:  Day report is now to days he has Court.  If he comes back to live back in Point, he is to let the Court now.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

11:02 a.m  Court calls case.
ADA Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Knaapen states facts for anticipated charges of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, Possession of THC and Possession with Intent - Schedule IV Drug.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a cash bond of $500.00  with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  February 23, 2015 @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2
